sections.The Old Gods and the New: King [[Joffrey Baratheon]] triggers a citywide riot when protestors throw excrement at him by demanding that his guards kill them all. Bronn's men are hard pressed to restore order and several [[goldcloaks]] are killed.<ref name="E16">"[[The Old Gods and the New]]"</ref>
sections.TOP: Bronn Season 208129hhlrb2s7i0a3t25ek5iizg9lttc2orc1167642014-03-06T03:23:34ZGreater good3347453{{Template:Delete}}In '''[[Season 2]] [[Bronn]]''' becomes a major character having appeared as a recurring character in [[Season 1]]. He is still serving [[Tyrion Lannister]]. Tyrion takes up his position as acting [[Hand of the King]] to [[Joffrey Baratheon]] and makes Bronn commander of the [[City Watch]] of [[King's Landing]].
sections.Garden of Bones:
[[Joffrey Baratheon]] orders [[Sansa Stark]] publicly beaten by Ser [[Meryn Trant]] as retribution for [[Robb Stark]]'s victory in the [[Battle of Oxcross]]. Tyrion enters the Iron Throne room with [[Bronn]] as Meryn attacks Sansa and demands an explanation. He asks Meryn what kind of knight beats a helpless girl and Meryn says the kind that follows their king. Bronn sarcastically warns Meryn to be careful of getting blood on his white cloak. Tyrion orders Sansa covered and reminds Joffrey that he is engaged to marry her. [[Sandor Clegane]] tears off his white cloak and gives it to Sansa. Joffrey says that he was punishing her. Tyrion wonders what crimes she committed and elucidates that she did not fight in Robbâ€™s battle, calling Joffrey a half wit. Joffrey asserts that he can do as he likes as king. Tyrion reminds Joffrey of the fate of the [[Mad King]], who ruled without regard for the consequences of his actions until he was killed by Jaime. Meryn warns Tyrion not to threaten Joffrey and Tyrion counters that he is educating his nephew. He orders Bronn to kill Meryn if he speaks again and tells Meryn that he has now made a threat. Tyrion helps Sansa up and walks her out of the throne room. He apologizes for Joffreyâ€™s behaviour and asks if she wants to end the engagement. She asserts her loyalty and love for Joffrey. Tyrion calls her Lady Stark and says that she may yet survive her captivity. Bronn says that Joffreyâ€™s aggression stems from sexual tension and suggests organizing a prostitute to temper his cruelty. The plan backfires and Joffrey forces one of the prostitutes to beat the other and show Tyrion what she has done.<ref>"[[Garden of Bones]]"</ref>

Tyrion turns Cersei's lover [[Lancel Lannister]] into his spy by threatening to reveal their incestuous relationship.<ref>"[[Garden of Bones]]"</ref>
sections.The Night Lands: Tyrion has [[Janos Slynt]] as a dinner guest in the dining room of the Tower of the Hand. Janos is the commander of the City Watch and the man responsible for carrying out the massacre of Robert's bastards. Tyrion questions Janos's involvement and his scruples. Janos stands up and threatens Tyrion, calling him a dwarf, but Tyrion points out Bronn behind Janos. Tyrion elucidates that he intends to serve as Hand of the King until [[Tywin Lannister]]'s return from the war and that he cannot trust Janos as Commander of the City Watch because he betrayed Tyrion's predecessor [[Eddard Stark]]. Janos insists that his friends at court will not allow Tyrion to replace him and that they will hear what Joffrey has to say. Tyrion says that they will not and nods to Bronn who summons four gold cloaks. Tyrion tells Janos that he is being sent to take the black and that he will leave on a ship for [[Eastwatch]] later that night. Tyrion says that he hopes Janos will enjoy [[the Wall]] and adds that he found it beautiful in a brutal, uncomfortable way. Bronn tells Janos that the gold cloaks will escort him to the ship because the city streets aren't safe at night. Janos insists that the men are under his command and Tyrion explains that Bronn is now commander of the city watch. Janos is dragged off, still protesting about his connections at court. Tyrion pours wine for Bronn and toasts to his appointment. He then asks if Bronn would murder an infant without question if ordered. Bronn says that he would ask how much.<ref>"[[The Night Lands]]"</ref>
sections.The North Remembers: Bronn accompanies [[Tyrion Lannister]] to [[King's Landing]] where Tyrion becomes the acting [[Hand of the King]] on orders from [[Tywin Lannister]]. [[Stannis Baratheon]] sends copies of a letter detailing Queen [[Cersei Lannister]]'s incestuous relationship with her twin [[Jaime Lannister|Jaime]] and the illegitimacy of her children to high lords throughout the seven kingdoms. Later, several of King [[Robert Baratheon]]'s bastards are brutally murdered by the [[City Watch]].<ref>"[[The North Remembers]]"</ref>
sections.What is Dead May Never Die: Tyrion identifies [[Grand Maester]] [[Pycelle]] as an informant to Cersei. He has Bronn check on him and Bronn finds him alone with a prostitute and fetches Tyrion. Tyrion, Bronn and [[Timett]] burst into Pycelle's chamber while he is in bed with the prostitute [[Daisy]]. Pycelle denies his crime but Tyrion explains that he has implicated himself because he was the only one aware of the information he revealed to Cersei. Tyrion asks how long Pycelle has been spying for Cersei and Pycelle claims that he has been loyal to House Lannister since the days of the [[Mad King]]. Tyrion brings up his betrayals of past Hands of the King and suggests that he poisoned [[Jon Arryn]]. Pycelle convincingly denies any involvement in the death. Tyrion orders Pycelle confined to the black cells and pays Daisy for her trouble.<ref>"[[What is Dead May Never Die]]"</ref>
